kitchenGarden.tip1Text: Place near window, needs 4-6 hours of light daily
kitchenGarden.tip2Text: Water when soil is dry, don't overwater
kitchenGarden.tip3Text: Cut from the top, new shoots will grow

howItWorksSection.title: How does it work?
howItWorksSection.subtitle: Join the green movement with simple steps.
howItWorksSection.step1Desc: Create your profile through the app or website. This will be your personal space to track your ecological contribution.
howItWorksSection.step2Desc: Select a tree species suitable for your region from our catalog and place an online order.
howItWorksSection.step3Desc: Your order will be delivered by our local partners at a convenient time. Each tree comes with a unique QR code.
howItWorksSection.step4Desc: Access information about your tree via QR code, track its ecological impact and enjoy your achievements.

grandmaStories.title: Our Grandmothers' Gardening Secrets
grandmaStories.subtitle: Short stories in Uzbek - experiences passed down from generation to generation
grandmaStories.story1Title: The Secret of Watering in Moonlight
grandmaStories.story1Text: My grandmother said: 'Don't water the garden on a full moon night, plants drink too much water and the roots rot. Water during the new moon, the plant will grow strong.' I've been doing this for 40 years, never failed.
grandmaStories.story1Author: Tashkent, Chilonzor - Fotima opa, 68 years old
grandmaStories.story2Text: My father taught: 'Plant apple and pear side by side, they are friends. But plant apricot and peach farther apart, they are rivals.' Indeed, friendly trees grow well side by side and help each other.
grandmaStories.story3Text: My mother always collected eggshells, crushed them, and added to the soil. 'This is the best calcium, the tree will be strong' she said. Now I do the same, my tomatoes are better than market ones.
grandmaStories.shareSubtitle: What gardening secrets does your family have?
grandmaStories.storyTitlePlaceholder: Example: My grandmother's tomato planting method
